co-.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: to coexist  (=exist together or at the same time)
co-.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: doing something with someone else as an equal or with less responsibility
co-.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: my co-author  (=someone who wrote the book with me)
the co-pilot  (=someone who helps a pilot)
co-.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: an officer who is in charge of a military unit
co-.translation[5].definitions[0].defini: added to the front of a noun to show that someone does a job with someone else
co-.translation[5].definitions[0].exampl: Her brother is co-director of a medical research firm.
The claims will be paid by American International and six other co-insurers.
